com.vaadin.fluent.api

Interface FluentButton<THIS extends FluentButton<THIS>>

  • Type Parameters:
    THIS - Self-referential generic THIS
    All Superinterfaces:
    com.vaadin.server.ClientConnector, com.vaadin.ui.Component, com.vaadin.ui.Component.Focusable, com.vaadin.shared.Connector, com.vaadin.event.ContextClickEvent.ContextClickNotifier, com.vaadin.event.FieldEvents.BlurNotifier, com.vaadin.event.FieldEvents.FocusNotifier, FluentAbstractComponent<THIS>, FluentAbstractFocusable<THIS>, FluentClientConnector<THIS>, FluentComponent<THIS>, FluentComponent.FluentFocusable<THIS>, FluentContextClickNotifier<THIS>, FluentFieldEvents.FluentBlurNotifier<THIS>, FluentFieldEvents.FluentFocusNotifier<THIS>, FluentSizeable<THIS>, Serializable, com.vaadin.server.Sizeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FButton, FNativeButton

    public interface FluentButton<THIS extends FluentButton<THIS>>
extends FluentAbstractFocusable<THIS>
    The base interface for fluent versions of Button
    See Also:
    Button

    • Method Detail

      • withClickListener

        default THIS withClickListener(com.vaadin.ui.Button.ClickListener listener)
        Adds the button click listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - the Listener to be added.
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Button.addClickListener(ClickListener)

      • withClickShortcut

        default THIS withClickShortcut(int keyCode,
                               int... modifiers)
        Makes it possible to invoke a click on this button by pressing the given ShortcutAction.KeyCode and (optional) ShortcutAction.ModifierKeys.
        The shortcut is global (bound to the containing Window).
        Parameters:
        keyCode - the keycode for invoking the shortcut
        modifiers - the (optional) modifiers for invoking the shortcut, null for none
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Button.setClickShortcut(int, int...)

      • withDisableOnClick

        default THIS withDisableOnClick(boolean disableOnClick)
        Determines if a button is automatically disabled when clicked. If this is set to true the button will be automatically disabled when clicked, typically to prevent (accidental) extra clicks on a button.

        Note that this is only used when the click comes from the user, not when calling Button.click() method programmatically. Also, if developer wants to re-enable the button, it needs to be done programmatically.

        Parameters:
        disableOnClick - true to disable button when it is clicked, false otherwise
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Button.setDisableOnClick(boolean)

      • withIconAlternateText

        default THIS withIconAlternateText(String iconAltText)
